page.title: 05Fraserburgh Harbour
page.content: It was on the 9th of March 1576 that Sir Alexander Fraser opened the harbour.The first extension was built in 1821 when King George 111 was on the throne. In 1971 the harbour was deepened by a dredger.They had to dam up the pier.In 1978 it was deepened again.The Faithlie is the deepest place.It is 4 metres deep.Here are the names of some of the piers:Bruce's Jetty,Chalmers' Jetty and Bissett's Quay. There are two lighthouses,one at the harbour and the newer one at Kinnaird's Head.On the Balaclava Pier there are huge sheds for nets and things like that.In the harbour the boats are tied to the pier with thick ropes. . The North Sea was called the German Ocean until 1818.
